metadata.Title: CVE-2020-9281 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: A cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the HTML Data Processor for CKEditor 4.0 before 4.14 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script through a crafted "protected" comment (with the cke_protected syntax).

criterions.comment: ckeditor: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
